Sometime I want to use tumblr just as a normal blog, for example, to write a long post like my previous tip about Kai-Fu Lee. As rich text editors on web pages always give me surprises, I tried something else.

A Solution

Using markdown to write makes me feel pretty comfortable. And with this tool written in Ruby, you can publish whatever you wrote in markdown directly to your Tumblr with just one command:

$ tumblr path/to/a_post.markdown
Email Address: tumblr-user@foobarmail.com
Password:   
Published to Tumblr. The ID for this post is: 123456789

Easy! But it's far from perfect...

Drawbacks

  1. Need to input your email/password every time. You can keep them in a config file but that makes me feel unsecured.
  2. It's a one-shot deal. If you got something wrong in your post, you have to edit it in Tumblr's editor or create a new post. Using TextMate's preview function before posting will save you a lot of time.
  3. The ––– style for h2 doesn't work as ––– is used for meta info section.
